results.firPara: In todays Fiver Arsène Wengers hair, football Einsteins and more
results.secPara: In todays Fiver Arsène Wengers hair, football Einsteins and more
results.webTitle: The Fiver | One thing has remained the same

results.firPara: Atléticos sharp thinking and ability to strike when a rare chance is presented earned them a draw against Barcelona, who must now make do without Messi
results.secPara: Atléticos sharp thinking and ability to strike when a rare chance is presented earned them a draw against Barcelona, who must now make do without Messi
results.webTitle: Atlético Madrid quick to pounce on Barça weakness after Lionel Messi makes way | Sid Lowe

results.firPara: Uefa has opened disciplinary proceedings against the Scottish Football Association after the countrys under-19s womens team pulled out of a European Championship qualifier against Serbia on Monday.
results.secPara: The game was postponed after the Scots informed the authorities that a sickness bug had hit nine players and eight members of the backroom staff. The SFA states that a local doctor confirmed the outbreak of gastroenteritis but that has not prevented Serbian media reports claiming the Scottish team were too affected by drinking to play after celebrating an earlier win against Albania.
results.webTitle: Uefa hits Scotland U19s football team with ‘refusal to play’ charge

results.firPara: Jonathan Kodjia was on his way to becoming an accountant before he got the break that led to him becoming the subject of the biggest transfer deal in the history of the Championship. Aston Villa paid Bristol City £11m in August to sign the striker but the fee could rise to £15m, depending on achievements; a record for Englands second tier. Its a big honour, I was surprised when I was told it was a record because I would never have dreamed of that, the affable 26-year-old says at the Bodymoor Heath training ground. I didnt really have a club until I was 18.
results.secPara: Kodjia was born and bred in Seine‑Saint-Denis, the same commune in the northern suburbs of Paris that produced France internationals such as Alou Diarra and Moussa Sissoko and around a dozen other players who have enjoyed solid careers. Being such fertile territory, the place is teeming with scouts but Kodjia had not caught the eye of any of them by the time he left school in 2007, so he enrolled at college to build on his baccalaureate in accountancy.
results.webTitle: Jonathan Kodjia: ‘People are going to be pleasantly surprised by Aston Villa’

results.firPara: A player once billed as the next Gianfranco Zola has had a nomadic career, but a fine start to his season offer hope that his promise can finally be fulfilled
results.secPara: At Milan they used to think Simone Verdi could become Italys next Gianfranco Zola. His team-mates even started to refer to him by the former Chelsea players nickname Magic Box. Just like Zola, Verdi was an undersized second striker with a hint of mischief and spellbindingly brilliant technique. Unlike Zola, he was equally happy striking the ball with either foot.
results.webTitle: Simone Verdi's start at Bologna suggests his talents can finally blossom | Paolo Bandini

results.firPara: Jürgen Klopp has said it is imperative Liverpool remain angry and the Anfield crowd holds Hull City in the same regard as Barcelona, Borussia Dortmund or Chelsea for his team to maintain their impressive start to the season.
results.secPara: The Liverpool manager made an impassioned appeal for patience from supporters before the match against the newly promoted side on Saturday. Liverpool have won their past three fixtures, scoring nine goals in the process, and have taken maximum points from Arsenal and Chelsea away plus champions Leicester City at home. Their only setback to date was a 2-0 defeat at Burnley, a result that again demonstrated Liverpools tendency to falter against the so-called lesser lights of the Premier League. But Klopp insists there is a need for consistency not only from his players but in how Liverpool supporters view the opposition.
results.webTitle: Jürgen Klopp calls on Liverpool to be ‘angry’ against Hull City

results.firPara: Families of the 96 will collect the awards at a ceremony in the city, with Kenny Dalglish among those also receiving the honour
results.secPara: The 96 Hillsborough victims will be honoured with the freedom of the city of Liverpool in a ceremony on Thursday evening.
results.webTitle: Hillsborough victims to posthumously receive freedom of Liverpool

results.firPara: The Frenchman took the reins at Arsenal 20 years ago today and despite leaner times in recent years his impact and influence is undeniable
results.secPara: Happy anniversary then, Arsène. You were the future once. Like most ageing pop culture icons Arsène Wenger has by now pretty much completed the full circuit from youthful innovator, new broom and all-round king of the wild frontier to something that looks a bit like the opposite stick in the mud, barnacle, emissary from the distant past.
results.webTitle: Arsène Wenger should have won more but English football owes him a lot | Barney Ronay

results.firPara: José Mourinho has hit out at football Einsteins for trying to undermine his and Manchester Uniteds achievements in the wake of the teams recent run of three successive losses.
results.secPara: United returned to winning ways in beating League Ones Northampton Town 3-1 in the third-round of the EFL Cup on Wednesday. Afterwards, Mourinho praised his team for delivering a positive performance before turning on critics following the scrutiny that has come his and Uniteds way following defeats to Manchester City, Feyenoord and Watford last week.
results.webTitle: José Mourinho hits out at ‘football Einsteins’ for trying to undermine him

results.firPara: Roberto Di Matteo confirmed on Thursday that an internal investigation has started at the club into media publicity surrounding Aston Villas Jack Grealish.
results.secPara: The manager refused to confirm newspaper suggestions that the midfielder is set to be fined two weeks wages following the players latest off-field indiscretions, which allegedly concern an all-night party at a Birmingham hotel on Saturday evening, or that the midfielder will be dropped but did reveal his disappointment following the latest publicity.
results.webTitle: Jack Grealish told to grow up by Roberto Di Matteo after hotel party reports
